Laura Gibbs · 127. Krishna Speaks with Karna
Before leaving Hastinapura, Krishna sought out Karna. "Because I love you," Krishna said, "I tell you the truth: you are Kunti's first-born son, Yudhishthira's elder brother. Yudhishthira doesn't know this, but if you tell him, he will gladly make you king. Go to him, Karna. It is the right thing to do.""It cannot be right for me to betray Duryodhana," Karna replied. "Duryodhana is my friend, and the Pandavas are my enemies. The truth of my birth changes nothing.""And your loyalty is Duryodhana's doom," Krishna said sadly.Thus Krishna's mission failed: he could not stop the coming war.
Inspired by: The Mahabharata: A Shortened Modern Prose Version by R. K. Narayan
Notes: This story is from Chapter 13: Action.Karna

content.text: Krishna stood outside the grand palace of Hastinapura, his heart heavy with the weight of his mission. He knew that time was running out, and he had to find Karna before it was too late. With determined steps, he made his way through the bustling streets, his mind filled with thoughts of the impending war.

Finally, Krishna arrived at Karna's humble dwelling on the outskirts of the city. The air was thick with tension as he approached the door, unsure of how Karna would react to his presence. Taking a deep breath, he knocked on the door, his knuckles rapping against the wood.
The door creaked open, revealing Karna standing before him, his eyes filled with a mixture of surprise and suspicion. "Krishna," he said, his voice laced with caution. "What brings you here?"
Krishna looked into Karna's eyes, his gaze filled with compassion. "Because I love you," he said softly, "I tell you the truth: you are Kunti's first-born son, Yudhishthira's elder brother."

Karna's eyes widened in disbelief, his mind struggling to comprehend the words that Krishna had just spoken. "But how can this be?" he asked, his voice trembling. "If what you say is true, then why was I abandoned at birth?"
